intro: Anacampseros grisea, commonly known as the gray anacampseros, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems and small, spiky leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers during the summer months, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick stems and leaves. Due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
